$comment:
This JSON Schema validates blueprint files that define the configuration structure for mods using the Mod Configuration Menu (MCM).
It ensures the blueprint adheres to the expected format and contains all necessary elements for proper MCM integration.

oneOf.description: SchemaVersion 1 is used for all MCM blueprints that are built for MCM 1.0.0 and above (but not for MCM 2.0.0, if it ever exists).

SchemaVersion.description:
The version of the MCM schema that this file uses. This is used to ensure that the file is compatible with the version of MCM that is being used.
DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE unless you know what you are doing. Use the version corresponding to the MCM version you are developing for.
Schema versions will follow MCM's MAJOR versions: SchemaVersion 1 is used for MCM 1.0.0 and above, SchemaVersion 2 will be used for MCM 2.0.0 and above, and so on.

ModName.description:
The name of the mod to use instead of its registered name. This can be useful for mods that have registered names that are not properly formatted or for mods that historically had multiple names due to multiple versions.
Note that you can always change your mod's name in its meta.lsx file without repercussions.
examples: My Mod Name To Be Displayed On MCM

Tabs.description:
The tabs that will be displayed in the MCM menu.
Each tab can contain either sections or settings.
Tabs are displayed in the order that they are defined in this file, in the top section of MCM's ImGui window.

Sections.description:
The sections that will be displayed in the MCM menu.
Each section can contain either tabs or settings.
Sections are displayed in the order that they are defined in this file.

Settings.description:
The list of sections to be displayed outside of any tabs in the MCM menu.
It is advised to use tabs and sections instead of settings at root level, as this can lead to an unorganized MCM menu.

Tab.description: A single tab in the MCM menu.

TabName.description:
The name of the tab that will be displayed in the MCM menu, on the tab's button.
Will be localized if a handle is provided.

TabId.description:
The unique identifier for the tab.
This value should be unique across all tabs in the blueprint.

TabDescription.description:
The description of the tab.
Will be localized if a handle is provided.
Currently unused.
TabDescription.$comment: This might not be used at all, but it's here just in case.

VisibleIf.description:
Array of Conditions that determine the visibility of this tab.
A Condition is an object with SettingId, Operator, and ExpectedValue.

Tabs.description: The tabs that will be displayed within the tab. They provide a distinct visual separation in the MCM menu.

Sections.description: The sections that will be displayed within the tab. They provide a distinct visual separation in the MCM menu, with headers and optional descriptions.

Settings.description: The settings that will be displayed within the tab.

Handles.description: Handles to localize the tab's strings.

Id.description:
The unique identifier for the setting, used to identify the setting in the code for both MCM and the mod consuming the API.
This will be used in your code, so it still should be human-readable and descriptive.

OldId.description:
The former unique identifier for the setting, used in order to keep user value if changing Id for any reason.
Not needed if you are not changing the Id of a setting.

Name.description:
The name of the setting as it will be displayed in the MCM menu.
Will be localized if a handle is provided.

oneOf.description: An input field for an integer value.
An input field for a floating-point number.
A boolean checkbox.
A single-line string text input.

A list of items with a text input below to add new items.
The list is initialized with default values if provided.
An enumeration of predefined values, displayed as a dropdown list where only one value can be selected.
A slider for integer values; can be used for a range of values defined between a Min and Max value.
A slider for floating-point values; can be used for a range of values defined between a Min and Max value.
A draggable input for integer values.
A draggable input for floating-point values.
A set of radio buttons. Options passed in are mutually exclusive.
A square color picker widget that allows the user to select a color with the mouse, while also having color fields for manual input.
A color editor widget. Similar to a color picker, but with only the color fields displayed.
A keybinding input, consisting of an optional modifier and a key.

Type.description: The type of the setting, which determines which ImGui widget will be displayed in the MCM menu.

Default.description: The default value of the setting. It will be used for initialization and as a fallback if the current value is not found or invalid in the settings JSON.

Tooltip.description: The tooltip that will be displayed when the user hovers over the setting in the MCM menu. Will be localized if a handle is provided.

Description.description: The description of the setting that will be displayed as text next to the ImGui widget in the MCM menu. Will be localized if a handle is provided.

Choices.description: The available set of choices for the setting, used for enum and radio types.

Min.description: The minimum value for the setting, used for slider/drag types.

Max.description: The maximum value for the setting, used for slider/drag types.

Multiline.description: Whether the text input should be multiline, used for text type.

Options.description: Additional options for the setting, depending on its type (e.g. choices for enum and radio types, min and max for slider type). Will be localized if handles are provided.

Handles.description: Handles to localize the setting's strings.

VisibleIf.description: Array of Conditions that determine the visibility of this setting. A Condition is an object with SettingId, Operator, and ExpectedValue.

Setting.description: A single setting in the MCM menu, which can be of various types for different input methods.

examples.Name: Checkbox Setting
examples.Description: This setting can be toggled on or off.

examples.Name: List Setting
examples.Description: This setting allows adding or removing items from a list.

examples.Name: Enum Setting
examples.Description: This setting allows selecting one option from a predefined list.

examples.Name: Slider Int Setting
examples.Tooltip: This is an integer slider setting.
examples.Description: This setting allows selecting an integer value within a range.

examples.Name: Slider Float Setting
examples.Tooltip: This is a float slider setting.
examples.Description: This setting allows selecting a floating-point value within a range.

examples.Name: Drag Int Setting
examples.Tooltip: This is an integer drag setting.
examples.Description: This setting allows dragging to select an integer value.

examples.Name: Drag Float Setting
examples.Tooltip: This is a float drag setting.
examples.Description: This setting allows dragging to select a floating-point value.

examples.Name: Radio Setting
examples.Description: This setting allows selecting one option from a set of radio buttons.

examples.Name: Color Picker Setting
examples.Tooltip: This is a color picker setting.
examples.Description: This setting allows selecting a color using a color picker.

examples.Name: Color Edit Setting
examples.Tooltip: This is a color edit setting.
examples.Description: This setting allows editing a color value directly.

examples.Name: Keybinding Setting
examples.Description: This setting allows setting a keybinding with an optional modifier.

SectionId.description: The unique identifier for the section. This value should be unique across all sections in the blueprint.

SectionName.description: The name of the section that will be displayed as a header in the MCM menu. Will be localized if a handle is provided.

SectionDescription.description: The description of the section that will be displayed as a description in the MCM menu. Will be localized if a handle is provided.

Tabs.description: The tabs that will be displayed within the section. They provide a distinct visual separation in the MCM menu, with headers and optional descriptions.

Settings.description: The settings that will be displayed within the section.

Handles.description: Handles to localize the section's strings.

VisibleIf.description: Array of Conditions that determine the visibility of this section. Condition is an object with SettingId, Operator, and ExpectedValue.

IsCollapsible.description: Whether the section is collapsible or not.

Section.description: A section within a tab in the MCM menu.

NameHandle.description: The handle to be used to localize the name of the tab.

DescriptionHandle.description: The handle to be used to localize the description of the tab.

TabHandles.description: Handles that can be used to localize tab strings.

NameHandle.description: The handle to be used to localize the name of the section.

DescriptionHandle.description: The handle to be used to localize the description of the section.

SectionHandles.description: A list of handles that can be used to localize a section.

NameHandle.description: The handle to be used to localize the name of the setting.

DescriptionHandle.description: The handle to be used to localize the description of the setting.

TooltipHandle.description: The handle to be used to localize the tooltip of the setting.

ChoicesHandles.description: Handles that can be used to localize choices for the setting.

SettingHandles.description: Handles that can be used to localize a setting.

LogicalOperator.description: The logical operator to use between the conditions. Defaults to 'and'.

VisibilityCondition.description: A boolean expression that determines the visibility of this element.

SettingId.description: The ID of the setting used for the comparison.

oneOf.description: Check if value of SettingId is equal to ExpectedValue
Check if value of SettingId is not equal to ExpectedValue
Check if value of SettingId is greater than ExpectedValue
Check if value of SettingId is less than ExpectedValue
Check if value of SettingId is greater than or equal to ExpectedValue
Check if value of SettingId is less than or equal to ExpectedValue

Operator.description: The operator to use for the comparison, as in the following order: setting's value <OPERATOR> ExpectedValue.

ExpectedValue.description: The expected value of the setting specified by SettingId for this element to be visible.
